column4: i need some help i bought a new video card and now ubuntu wont work i think it needs xfree86 (as stated on the box) i tried apt-get xserver-xfree86 but that done barely anything
what kind of video card?
nvidia 6200 256mb
do you have Nvidia's drivers from their website installed?
it wont let me startx
: but did you install nvidia's drivers?
how do i do that?
shouldnt ubuntu detect it on install?
hmmm how come it didnt work when i done "apt-get xserver-xfree86"
install*
yes but cant u override it
beh its prolly easier if i find another distro
it doesnt work with my video card
Nvidia*
well it doesnt
: No, you need to install the Nvidia drivers, you will on any distro. Any mainstream distro does not include the drivers because they are not open source
i put Knoppix in before and it works fine
well, open your /etc/X11/xorg.conf file and tell me which display driver is installed
i'd have to restart my computer to do that
: what are you in right now?
